channel.title: JTabbedPane
channel.description: Hey. Let's say I'm using a JTabbedPane, and I have a (custom) JPanel on one tab that has an appletstub implemented into it. How can I get the variables related to the appletstub, that is, a reference to the class in THAT JPanel?

item.title: JTabbedPane
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:307167”][quote author=oksuper_ link=topic=403291.msg2986874#msg2986874 date=1255039991]

How can an AppletStub be implemented “into” a JPanel? Fuck off and go learn before trying to write some little runescape bot plx.
[/quote]im pretty sure what he meant to say was:

“i am using a jtabbedpane, in which each tab holds a specific instance of a jpanel class. each jpanel holds an instance of the applet class. how would i get the applet that has been added to a specific tab?”

at least thats how i interpreted it

i know damn well what he means, he is an idiot though, and i do not encourage idiots trying to accomplish something too complex for them.

Sounds like you need a break from posting then, since on this website we try to help everyone. The question is legitimate, and there is nothing wrong with it, regardless of whether he is attempting to make a bot or not.[/quote]
speak for yourself

Read full topic

item.title: JTabbedPane
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

are you asking how to access components that have been added to a container (jpanel is a child class of panel which is a child class of container)?

if so, you can use methods like: getComponent, getComponentAt, getComponents, etc

take a look at the javadocs

Read full topic
